steps.title: Place the first four ingredients into a heat-safe jar or measuring cup.
steps.content: Place the first four ingredients into a heat-safe jar or measuring cup. You will need ¼ cup (60 milliliters) of almond oil, 2 tablespoons (28.35 grams) of coconut oil, 2 tablespoons (28.24 grams) of beeswax pellets, and 1 tablespoon (13.63 grams) of shea butter. Hold off on the vitamin E oil and essential oil for now. [1] X Research source You can make your own olive oil at home by blending a cup of raw almonds with 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of olive oil. Store it in your fridge for 2 weeks then filter it into a storage container!

steps.title: Bring some water to a simmer in a pot.
steps.content: Bring some water to a simmer in a pot. Fill a pot with 3 to 4 inches (7.62 to 10.16 centimeters) of water. Place the pot on the stove and bring the water to a simmer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Place the jar into the water and let the contents melt.
steps.content: Place the jar into the water and let the contents melt. Take the jar that you jut added the oils, beeswax, and shea butter into, and set it into the pot. Leave the jar in the pot until everything melts, stirring occasionally. Do not cover the pot or the jar with anything. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Take the jar out of the water and add the vitamin E oil.
steps.content: Take the jar out of the water and add the vitamin E oil. Use a pot holder or an oven mitt to take the jar out of the water. Set it down onto a heat-safe surface. Let it cool for a few moments, then stir in ½ teaspoon of vitamin E oil oil. [4] X Research source Vitamin E oil that comes in a bottle will be easier to measure out, but you can use the capsule kind--just pierce the capsules first.

steps.title: Consider adding in a 2 to 3 drops of essential oil.
steps.content: Consider adding in a 2 to 3 drops of essential oil. You can use any type of essential oil you like. Start with 2 to 3 drops, then add more if needed. The essential oil will give your face cream a nice smell. Some types of essential oil also have skin care benefits, for example: [5] X Research source Acne or oily skin: lavender, lemongrass, palmarosa, peppermint, rosemary Dry or aging skin: lavender, palmarosa, rose, rose geranium Normal skin: rose, rose geranium Any skin type: chamomile, palmarosa

steps.title: Transfer the mixture to a clean jar, then let it cool and harden.
steps.content: Transfer the mixture to a clean jar, then let it cool and harden. Pour the cream into a 4-ounce (120-milliliter), glass jar, preferably one with a wide mouth. Let the cream cool and harden at room temperature.

steps.title: Close the jar, then store it in a cool, dry place.
steps.content: Close the jar, then store it in a cool, dry place. This cream is safe to use in the evenings and mornings. It will last about 3 months. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Place your oils and beeswax in a double-boiler.
steps.content: Place your oils and beeswax in a double-boiler. Fill a saucepan with 2 inches (5.08 centimeters) of water, then place a heat-safe glass bowl on top. Add ½ cup (108 grams) of coconut oil, 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of jojoba oil, and 1½ tablespoons (21.32 grams) beeswax pellets. [7] X Research source Hold off on the aloe vera and essential oil for now.

steps.title: Melt the oils and beeswax.
steps.content: Melt the oils and beeswax. Turn the heat up to medium and allow the water to come to a simmer. Let the oils and beeswax melt, stirring occasionally. You are ready once they turn liquid and translucent. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the mixture into a blender and let it cool 1 to 1½ hours.
steps.content: Pour the mixture into a blender and let it cool 1 to 1½ hours. Make sure that your blender can withstand heat (ie: glass). If your blender is plastic, let the mixture cool down first, then scrape it into the blender with a spatula. [9] X Research source If you don't have a blender, you can use a food processor instead.

steps.title: Blend the mixture while slowly adding the aloe vera gel.
steps.content: Blend the mixture while slowly adding the aloe vera gel. Turn the blender onto a low speed setting. While it is turning, slowly pour 1 cup (236.5 grams) of aloe vera gel into it. From time to time, pause the blender, and scrape down the sides with a rubber spatula. [10] X Research source Use a natural aloe vera gel. Don't use aloe vera juice or homemade gel.

steps.title: Add 5 to 8 drops of essential oil.
steps.content: Add 5 to 8 drops of essential oil. You don't have to do this, but it will give the cream a nice fragrance. [11] X Research source If you use the right type of essential oil, you could also benefit your skin. For example: [12] X Research source Acne or oily skin: lavender, lemongrass, palmarosa, peppermint, rosemary Dry or aging skin: lavender, palmarosa, rose, rose geranium Normal skin: rose, rose geranium Any skin type: chamomile, palmarosa

steps.title: Mix everything together, then transfer it to a clean, glass jars.
steps.content: Mix everything together, then transfer it to a clean, glass jars. Blend the mixture or whip it by hand until it is light and fluffy. Use a rubber spatula to transfer it into several small glass jars. ¼ or ½-ounce (60 or 120-milliliter) jars would work the bet.

steps.title: Store the jars in the fridge.
steps.content: Store the jars in the fridge. You can keep one of the jars in your bathroom, but you should store the rest in the fridge so that they last longer. Use the cream morning and evening within 3 to 4 months. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Place the wax and oils in a double boiler.
steps.content: Place the wax and oils in a double boiler. Fill a pot with 2 inches (5.08 centimeters) of water. Place a heat-safe glass bowl on top, then add the following: ¼ ounce (7.11 grams) beeswax pellets, 1 ounce (30 milliliters) almond oil, 1 ounce (28.35 grams) coconut oil, and ¼ teaspoon rosehip seed oil.

steps.title: Turn the heat up to medium and let everything melt, stirring occasionally.
steps.content: Turn the heat up to medium and let everything melt, stirring occasionally. As the ingredients melt, they will start to turn clear. You know they are ready when the color is translucent and no clumps remain.

steps.title: Add the tea to the mixture, and let it steep off-heat.
steps.content: Add the tea to the mixture, and let it steep off-heat. Take the bowl off of the pot and set it down onto a heat-safe surface. Add one bag of green tea into the melted oil and beeswax mixture. Let the tea steep for 15 minutes. You can keep the tea in the bag, or you can cut the bag open and pour the loose leaves into the mixture.

steps.title: Blend the mixture until it is creamy.
steps.content: Blend the mixture until it is creamy. You can do this with a hand mixer or a food processor fitted with a whisk. Keep mixing until the mixture turns room-temperature and creamy. If you added loose-leaf tea into the mixture, strain it through a fine, mesh sieve first.

steps.title: Transfer the mixture into a glass jar and let it cool.
steps.content: Transfer the mixture into a glass jar and let it cool. Choose an 8-ounce (240-milliliter) jar with a wide mouth. Use a rubber spatula to transfer the mixture into the jar. Let the mixture cool down further, then close the jar.

steps.title: Store the jar in a cool, dry place.
steps.content: Store the jar in a cool, dry place. This cream is great to use in the mornings and evenings. Use it within 3 months.
